alert.note: Alert for Lee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued March 14 at 3:02AM CDT until March 14 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 8 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 33. For the second Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 31 expected. * WHERE...Lee County. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Warning, until 10 AM CDT this morning. For the second Freeze Warning, from midnight tonight to 8 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
